transportAdvice: Jerusalem has a light rail line connecting key areas and an extensive bus network that covers most tourist sites, making public transit a practical option for getting around. The Old City and many historic neighborhoods are best explored on foot, and taxis are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cool and rainy with occasional cold snaps; the wettest period of the year and rare snowfall is possible.
Still cool and wet with continued rain; pack layers and a waterproof jacket.
Temperatures begin to rise and rain becomes less frequent as spring approaches.
Pleasant spring weather with mild temperatures and mostly sunny days; a great time to visit.
Warm and dry with long sunny days; comfortable for sightseeing outdoors.
Hot and almost entirely dry; clear skies dominate and evenings remain pleasant.
Peak summer heat with virtually no rain; stay hydrated and seek shade during midday.
Continues hot and dry similar to July; early morning and evening are the best times to explore.
Still warm and dry with gradually cooling evenings; very comfortable for travel.
Mild autumn temperatures with the first rains possible late in the month; pleasant overall.
Cooler and increasingly rainy as the wet season begins; bring a jacket and rain layer.
Cold and wet with frequent rain; the city can be festive but dress warmly and expect wet days.
